reason: HTML structure provides the semantic layout with agent-friendly DOM elements
description: Complete HTML5 document structure with semantic elements and stable IDs for web scraping. Includes header (site name, tagline, meal progress), main auction card (meal photo, name, description, category badge, countdown timer, current bid, status indicator), bid feed container, winner banner, and end screen. All elements use stable IDs from PRD §6 (#meal-name, #meal-description, #current-bid, #countdown, #auction-status, #meal-progress, #winner-banner, .bid-entry, .bid-amount, .bid-name) to enable reliable rtrvr agent parsing.

context_urls.purpose: HTML elements reference for semantic markup
Using stable ID attributes for DOM element identification
Semantic HTML best practices for accessibility

reason: Embedded CSS styles create the visual design with animations and responsive layout
description: Complete CSS embedded in <style> tag with warm color scheme (off-white/cream background), large prominent countdown timer, auction card layout using flexbox/grid, bid feed styling with slide-in animations, pulsing green 'LIVE' indicator, red countdown warning state (≤10s), and 'SOLD' celebration styling. Includes CSS keyframe animations for bid entry transitions and status indicator pulsing. Mobile-friendly but optimized for desktop demo.

context_urls.purpose: Flexbox layout for auction card and bid feed
CSS Grid for overall page layout
CSS animations for bid entry transitions and status indicators
Keyframe animations for pulsing and sliding effects

reason: Meal data module contains the hardcoded database of 6 meals
description: JavaScript IIFE module exporting MEALS constant array with 6 meal objects. Each object contains: id (unique slug), name (display name), description (1-2 sentences, self-deprecating), category ('asian'|'mexican'|'american'|'italian'|'other'), startingBid (USD number), photo (emoji string), auctionDuration (seconds). Order in array determines auction sequence. Meals: Tuesday's Pad Thai (asian, $1.50, 45s), Half a Burrito (mexican, $2.00, 40s), Mystery Stir Fry (asian, $1.00, 35s), Sad Desk Salad (american, $0.75, 40s), Quarter Pepperoni Pizza (american, $3.00, 50s), Leftover Lasagna Block (italian, $2.50, 45s).

context_urls.purpose: IIFE pattern for module encapsulation
JavaScript module pattern guide

reason: Utility helpers provide formatting and random selection functions
description: JavaScript IIFE module exporting utility functions: formatCurrency(amount) for USD formatting with 2 decimals, formatRelativeTime(timestamp) for relative time strings ('just now', '2s ago', etc.), randomInt(min, max) for inclusive random integer generation, randomChoice(array) for random array element selection, randomBidIncrement(isJump) for bid amount calculation ($0.10-$0.75 normal, $1.00-$2.00 jump bids). No dependencies, pure functions with no side effects.

context_urls.purpose: Math.random for random number generation
Date.now for timestamp generation

reason: Auction state module maintains centralized application state
description: JavaScript IIFE module exporting AuctionState singleton object and state mutation functions. State structure: currentMealIndex (number, index into MEALS array), bids (Bid[] array with {bidder: string, amount: number, timestamp: number}), startedAt (number, Date.now() timestamp), status ('active'|'sold'|'complete'). Exports functions: initAuction(), addBid(bidder, amount), getCurrentMeal(), getHighestBid(), advanceToNextMeal(), markAsSold(), isComplete(). All state mutations are synchronous and logged to console for debugging.

context_urls.purpose: IIFE pattern for state encapsulation

functions.name: getHighestBid
functions.returns: Highest bid amount or starting bid

functions.name: advanceToNextMeal
functions.returns: true if more meals exist, false otherwise

reason: Timer module manages countdown logic and triggers auction close
description: JavaScript IIFE module implementing countdown timer with setInterval. Exports startCountdown(durationSeconds, onTick, onComplete) function that ticks every 1000ms, calls onTick(remainingSeconds) callback each tick, and calls onComplete() when reaching zero. Automatically clears interval on completion. Handles edge case of zero/negative duration. Returns stopCountdown() function for manual cancellation. Used for auction countdown timer - onTick updates #countdown element and changes color to red when remainingSeconds ≤ 10.

context_urls.purpose: setInterval API for countdown ticking
clearInterval for timer cleanup

functions.name: startCountdown
functions.signature: startCountdown(durationSeconds: number, onTick: (remaining: number) => void, onComplete: () => void): () => void

reason: Bidding engine synthesizes fake bids to simulate active marketplace
description: JavaScript IIFE module implementing synthesized bidding logic with randomized timing. Exports startBiddingEngine(onBid) function that fires fake bids using setTimeout. Bidder names pool: ['FoodieGregory', 'BargainBeth', 'SnackAttack99', 'ThriftyTina', 'LunchLarry', 'DealDave', 'MealStealer', 'CheapEats_Carol', 'BidKing_Tom', 'LeftoverLove', 'BargainHunter_X', 'PricePete']. Timing: first bid 3-8s after start, subsequent bids 2-6s apart, last 10 seconds ramp up to 1-3s intervals. Bid amounts: increment current high bid by $0.10-$0.75 (normal) or $1.00-$2.00 (jump bid, ~20% chance). Calls onBid(bidder, amount) callback. Returns stopBiddingEngine() function. Stops automatically when auction status !== 'active'.

context_urls.purpose: setTimeout for randomized bid timing
Math.random for bid randomization

functions.name: startBiddingEngine
functions.signature: startBiddingEngine(onBid: (bidder: string, amount: number) => void): () => void
functions.sideEffects: Creates randomized timers, fires bid callbacks

reason: DOM render module handles all UI updates and element manipulation
description: JavaScript IIFE module managing all DOM manipulation. Exports functions: renderAuctionCard(meal, highestBid, countdown, status) updates #meal-name, #meal-description, #current-bid, #countdown, #auction-status elements; renderBidFeed(bids) rebuilds .bid-entry elements using DocumentFragment for performance, newest first, with slide-in animation; renderWinnerBanner(bidder, meal, amount) shows #winner-banner with celebration emoji; renderEndScreen() displays 'That's all folks' message; updateMealProgress(current, total) updates #meal-progress; updateCountdownColor(remaining) applies red class when ≤10s. Caches DOM selectors for performance. All rendering is synchronous and uses textContent (not innerHTML) to prevent XSS.

context_urls.purpose: getElementById for stable DOM element access
querySelector for CSS selector-based element access
DocumentFragment for efficient batch DOM updates
textContent for safe text updates without XSS risk

functions.name: renderAuctionCard
functions.signature: renderAuctionCard(meal: Meal, highestBid: number, countdown: number, status: string): void

functions.name: renderWinnerBanner
functions.signature: renderWinnerBanner(bidder: string, meal: Meal, amount: number): void

functions.name: updateCountdownColor
functions.sideEffects: Applies red class to countdown if ≤10s

reason: Auction lifecycle orchestrates all modules and controls state transitions
description: JavaScript IIFE module coordinating the auction flow. Exports init() function called on DOMContentLoaded. Implements state machine: Page Load → initialize meal database, start auction for meal[0], start countdown, start bidding engine, render initial UI. During Auction → countdown ticks every second, synthesized bids fire per timing rules, each bid updates #current-bid and bid feed, countdown turns red at ≤10s. Auction Close → countdown hits 0, stop bidding, set status 'sold', display winner banner, wait 3s, advance to next meal or show end screen. Handles all module coordination, error boundaries with console.error logging. No global scope pollution - all initialization via DOMContentLoaded event listener.

context_urls.purpose: DOMContentLoaded event for initialization timing
setTimeout for winner banner delay and transitions

functions.name: init
functions.sideEffects: Initializes entire application, starts auction lifecycle
